interestingFact: Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Brazil has the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,080 km.
China is the most populous country in the world and is home to the Great Wall, one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
Egypt is known for its ancient pyramids, which are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
France is home to the Eiffel Tower, one of the most recognizable structures in the world.
Germany is the largest economy in Europe and is known for its automotive industry, including brands like BMW and Mercedes-Benz.
India is the birthplace of four major world religions: Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, and Sikhism.
Indonesia is the largest archipelago in the world, with more than 17,000 islands.
Italy is home to the Colosseum and the Vatican, two of the most visited tourist destinations in the world.
Japan is known for its technology advancements and unique culture, and Tokyo is the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
Kenya is famous for its safaris and is home to the 'Big Five' game animals: lions, leopards, elephants, rhinos, and buffalo.
